page.title: 08GEOGRAPHICAL FEATURES
page.content: At the North end of Scampton is Tillbridge Lane Viewpoint. It is on the top of a steep slope called the limestone ridge; locally known as Lincoln Cliff. Although it is only 46 metres above sea level a good view is obtained of the plain below. To the West can be seen the River Trent and along its banks are the cooling towers of 3 power stations; High Marnham, Cottam and West Burton. The coal comes by rail from the East Midlands. The waters of the Trent are used in the manufacture of electricity. The waste fuel ash is used to manufacture building blocks. East of the River Trent is the smaller River Till and to the South Fossdyke canal, originally built by the Romans.
